summary: HPV is a common virus with over 200 types. Most infections have no symptoms and go away on their own. However, some types can cause warts or serious health problems like cancer in various body parts. HPV is spread mainly through skin-to-skin contact, especially during sexual activity. Vaccines can prevent HPV infection, and they are recommended for young people before they become sexually active. Regular health screenings can detect early signs of cancer caused by HPV.
title: Human papillomavirus infection
